event.location: KLM airplane en route from Tunis to Amsterdam
event.summary: 08/15/1993: An Egyptian man claiming to have a bomb hijacked a Dutch airliner traveling from Tunisia to Amsterdam and demanded the release of Sheik Omar Abdel-Rahman, who had been charged in the February bombing of the World Trade Center in New York. The hijacker released all 131 passengers and 7 crew members soon after the plane landed safely in Dusseldorf, Germany.
event.target1: KLM Boeing 737-400 flight from Tunis, Tunisia to Amsterdam, Netherlands
event.motive: Demand for the release of Sheik Omar Abdul-Rahman and the implementation of UN sanctions against Serbia.
event.scite1: Andreas Renhult, “Egyptian Seizes KLM Plane; Seek Sheik’s Freedom,” The Associated Press, August 15, 1993.
event.scite2: “Egyptian KLM hijacker advocate of Bosnian Moslem rights,” Agence France Presse, August 17, 1993.
